**Description:**

Decided to revamp my older craft file 'Experior' which had forward swept wings and a pelican tail. The 2nd version of the craft now has space plane capabilities and lots of functional and aesthetic adjustments. The aesthetic air intakes are now more functional by using circular intakes instead of the radial intakes. The Pelican tail has been moved to the bottom of the craft. This allows the rear landing gears to be spread further apart making landing easier on Mun or Minmus. Lift rating has also been increased to accommodate more fuel. And lastly the craft is still quite agile just like the original. If you wish to see the older version the link is below.

[TD]8 - empty[/TD]

[TD]9 - empty[/TD]

[/TR]

[TR]

[TD]5 - Cut Parachute[/TD]

[TD]10 - Toggle Ladder[/TD]

[/TR]

[/TABLE]

**Flight Help: Mun**

The usual space plane procedure. Use the jet engine till 2300 m/s then switch to the atomic engine to achieve orbit. You want to be at around 32,000m altitude to get up to speed with the jet engines. When acheiving Mun orbit reduce the periapsis to around 5-6k meters. When above the surface burn the atomic engines at an angle that mostly cuts horizontal speed while keeping you from smashing into the surface. Takes some practice so i'd suggest quick saving in orbit. To make the craft novice friendly there are 2 landing rockets for VTOL capabilities. When you are down to a sufficiently low speed switching to action group 3 will make landing a breeze. You only want to use the landing rockets for a few seconds as they are inefficient and can jeopardize the fuel requirements for a return to Kerbin.

[**DOWNLOAD Experior II**](http://www./download/36044514of2371b/X3s+Experior+II.craft)

[**Link to original**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/99374-Jet-Aircraft-X3a-Experior-Forward-swept-wings)
